intro: Oenanthe filipendula, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, finely divided, and often have a slight hairy texture. The plant is known for its mild, somewhat peppery scent, which is characteristic of many members of its family.
